description:
BC Assessment Property API Specification Development

BC Assessment believes better access to property information can create economic opportunities for companies across British Columbia.
 
We've been told that Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) are the way of the future to create data access.
 
We want your ideas to make an API that works, and works well.
 
That's why we're opening a collaboration around creating an API specification that we hope you will want to use, supported by a viable business model.
 
The collaboration will happen in two streams, one for entrepreneurs and businesses in the property market, the other for developers versed in the technical space of APIs. Some tech entrepreneurs may be interested in participating in both streams.
 
Read the Discussion Guide to learn how you can participate.

description:
Welcome to the Citizen Engagement Web Toolkit

The Citizen Engagement team helps government ministries engage the public to inform the development of policy and delivery of services. We organize and manage online public engagement initiatives. The team uses tools such as GovTogetherBC, a hub where people can find government’s engagement opportunities, and a custom WordPress installation with commenting and other functions to support the public engagement opportunities.

Our customizations include the ability to manage threaded comments and integrate 3rd party tools such as surveys. In the spirit of engagement, we are open sourcing the code for some of these WordPress customizations for others to use, and to collaborate with the community to help make them better.

Environmental Reporting BC Program Owner

Stephanie.Hazlitt@gov.bc.ca
description: Environmental Reporting BC provides access to scientific data and information about our environment and how it relates to British Columbians. This information comes in the form of indicators that examine the state and trends of different aspects of our environment. Our web-based model strives to serve the varied needs of our audiences, and provide timely, open, and dynamic reports on the environment that are easy to access and understand. Since its inception, Environmental Reporting BC has embraced openness, sharing methods and making the data underlying our analyses available on DataBC under the Open Government License – British Columbia. We are also moving our code – the scripts we write to get, prepare, analyse and present environmental data and information into the Province’s GitHub space.

shortDescription: BC Laws is a portal application that has been developed by the Queen's Printer of British Columbia to access BC provincial legislation.

closedHelpWantedIssues.title: Favourites Tree Threshold Limit Break
closedHelpWantedIssues.body: # Story: As a product owner I have discovered that the favourites tree is not working correctly as there is a threshold after which the favourites content tree becomes non-functional. # Additional detail: Goto: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/content/complete/statreg/?xsl=/templates/browse.xsl and click on Favourites. As a “Content Distributor” the user may already have a favourites tree but when they point a lot of content at it (Goto: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/content/arch_oic/arc_oic/?xsl=/templates/browse.xsl) the content tree becomes overwhelmed; so as an interim solution it was removed. So it’s not so much that the piece of work is adding documents, this is done through the application layer and consumed through the API interface, but that as I add documents the trees performance degrades to an unacceptable level. # Acceptance criteria: 1. Javascript tree contains a list of nodes that users can select. 2. Tree is created using the content API as described: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/template/complete/api/EP_API_content.html 3. Selected nodes are stored in a cookie called favIDS, as a list of ancestors separated by comma. Each selection/deselection of a folder/document updates the cookie and adds/deletes the corresponding ancestor to the listTree and should default open to the lowest complete branch. Examples: * If “A” is selected in its entirety Tree should open to the “A” folder * If “Access to Education” is selected in its entirety Tree should open to “Access to Education” * If “Access to Education” and the “P” folder is selected in its entirety the Tree should open to both “Access to Education” and the “P” folder 4. The list should also be adjusted such that if a parent is selected, the parent ancestor is added to the list and existing children ancestors are deleted. 5. The Advanced favourite search feature will grab all the ancestors in the cookie. If html5 storage is present, it is used instead of the cookie. 6. Tree must be able to be cleared using the clear favourites as per: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/content/complete/statreg/?xsl=/templates/browse.xsl 7. Tree should not substantially degrade in performance when used against larger document collections such as the Historical OIC collection: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/content/arch_oic/arc_oic/ 8. Tree should outperform current tree load time by 3X when initially loaded with browser session information cleared. Firefox web-developer profiler will be used to determine the success of the test. # How to contribute We will evaluate each pull request and choose the best solution to the issue based on the acceptance criteria. Submit the best solution and you could be paid $1000. More than one pull request may be considered for payment on this issue. Please read the [Contribution Guidelines](https://github.com/bcgov/bc-laws-api/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) for the Terms that set the rules for participation in a Pay for Pull, including how you’ll get paid if you are successful. Have questions? Please post your questions in the comments section below this issue. And check out our [Partners page](https://bcdevexchange.org/programs/BC%20Laws) for more information on our work.

description:
Welcome to BC Laws

BC Laws is a portal application that has been developed by the Queen's Printer of British Columbia to access BC provincial legislation. BC Laws is a modern alternative to traditional methods of online publishing which provides feature rich content in a machine consumable format (XML). This information can be accessed and published through our Application Programming Interface (API) which provides access to a significant amount of detailed legislative content. The API content is available through a permissive license which we hope will encourage citizens and companies to create new value added services further enabling citizen legislative access.

shortDescription: Vancouver released its Digital Strategy with commitments to support innovation and growth in the local digital economy.
description: Vancouver released its Digital Strategy with commitments to support innovation and growth in local digital economy. Enhancing the Open Data program was also identified as one of the key priorities. The Vancouver Open Data Catalog provides free and open access to over 145 datasets with new datasets added on a continual basis. Data is offered in machine-readable formats for everyone to use, reuse and redistribute under the terms of Open Government Licence – Vancouver.

description:
Surrey was recently named as one of the Top 7 Intelligent Communities for 2015, which confirms we are at the forefront in our use of digital technology to foster economic, social and cultural opportunities. Learn more.

In 2014, we released our Smart Surrey Strategy. This strategy serves as a guide for how technology and innovation are considered in decisions for existing and future City plans, programs and infrastructure. The strategy covers four key areas of action (Social Engagement & Connectivity, Economic Growth, Service Delivery Innovation and Smart City Infrastructure) and highlights 40 key initiatives that are either completed or underway. This strategy was recognized industry wide and established the City’s vision for how technology and innovation is leading the way to deliver a better and smart City.

shortDescription: FirstVoices Dictionary is an online application supporting the language documentation and revitalization initiatives of the First Peoples' Cultural Foundation
description:
Welcome to the FirstVoices Dictionary

FirstVoices Dictionary is an online application supporting the language documentation and revitalization initiatives of the First Peoples’ Cultural Foundation and managed by the First Peoples’ Cultural Council (FPCC). The FPCC's language repository, with over 70 First Nations languages is in need of modern revitalization in order to better meet the current web needs of a wide variety of stakeholders. The online application being built will seek to improve data collection, data storage, reusability and the delivery of educational resources online. We are looking at using the open-source Nuxeo product for Digital Asset Management, in addition to a customized user-interface for editors and visitors.

description: The BC Physical Address Geocoder web service locates and standardizes British Columbia civic addresses within your web pages and applications.  The Geocoder is a REST web service that lets you integrate real-time standardization, validation, and geocoding of physical addresses into your own applications. If you plan to integrate the BC Physical Address Geocoder into your applications, we encourage you to contact us and ask to receive important updates about the Geocoder.

shortDescription: The BC Data Catalogue provides information and access to more than 3500 government datasets web services (APIs) and online applications.
description: The BC Data Catalogue (BCDC) provides metadata and access to more than 3500 government datasets, web services (APIs) and online applications, including more than 1500 datasets licensed for commercial use under the Open Government License – British Columbia.  The catalogue provides both a web interface and APIs to help users search, understand and use datasets, APIs and online applications.  The open source code that powers the catalogue is available on GitHub. The code is based on the Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network (CKAN ) open source software project initiated by the Open Knowledge Foundation (OKF).   We are working to evolve our software development lifecycle (SDLC) to an open methodology that will share our development backlog.
contact:

greg.lawrance@gov.bc.ca

shortDescription: The City of Kamloops has joined the BCDevExchange profiling their open data which is now under the Open Government License - British Columbia.
resources:

description: The City of Kamloops is making publicly available data more easily accessible to developers, consultants and the general public through an Open Data portal at www.kamloops.ca/opendata. Currently snap-shot copies of data are available for download with work underway to introduce API access to live data. Our first collaboration is with community-based developers building a garbage day reminder service.

shortDescription: The Open511-DriveBC API serves DriveBC's implementation of the Open511 Specification for road incident construction and condition information.
news:
• Province opens up highway camera
    data to tech community
  • DriveBC Webcam Open Data Released, BCDevExchange Discovery Day March 16

  • The Road to Innovation is DriveBC’s Open511

  • DriveBC data now online and open for business
resources:
• Guide to Production API
  • API Terms of Use
  • Open Government License - British Columbia

  • DriveBC

  • Open 511.org 

  • API Console

  • BC HighwayCams

  • Webcam API Spec in GitHub
description:
The Open511-DriveBC API serves DriveBC’s implementation of the Open511 Specification. The Open511 standard provides a specification for road incident, construction and condition information. The API is a REST web service that lets you integrate real-time DriveBC data into your own applications. The data is available through the API machine consumable formats (XML & JSON). The API content is made available through the Open Government License – British Columbia which we hope will encourage citizens, companies, and other jurisdictions to both integrate DriveBC data into their services and applications. It also supports other jurisdictions to share their own road incident, construction and condition information in the same standard specification.

The Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MOTI) also wants to engage developers to help build out the draft webcam API specification. The draft was created in conjunction with OpenNorth, originators of the Open511 road event data standard. We invite you to collaborate in GitHub to further develop the webcam API specification so that it meets the needs of developers.

shortDescription: BCDevExchange is an experiment; an idea that needs to be proven. We will test validate and refine the idea with tech entrepreneurs and early adopters in the public sector.
description:
Welcome to the BCDevExchange

The BCDevExchange experiment aims to make it easier for the B.C. public and tech sectors to innovate and collaborate on digital products and services. We are demostrating how this collaboration can work as we build the BCDevExchange website. We are sharing the code base for the BCDevExchange web app under an open source license in GitHub. You can also track the work we are doing on the project either directly in GitHub or on our KanBan Workflow Board in Trello.

shortDescription: The City is interested in using technology and data to engage residents at a neighbourhood level.
techContact:
Application Developer


Del Turner
dturner@victoria.ca
description:
Openness and transparency are woven through every aspect of business at the City of Victoria, whether that is the routine release of City data, to using technologies to ensure citizens have easy access to services and information. Adopting Open Government principles and practices encourage an engaged and well-informed citizenry, and provides for higher quality services.

The City is interested in using technology and data to engage residents at a neighbourhood level – from amenities and events to planned capital projects and census statistics, providing information about a citizen’s neighbourhood at their fingertips.

shortDescription: TransLink is providing resources for software developers to promote the use of public transit and major roadways in Metro Vancouver.
description:
TransLink Developer Resources

TransLink is providing resources for software developers to promote the use of public transit and major roadways in Metro Vancouver.

TransLink currently has three publicly available Open Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) for developers.

The TransLink Open API provides access to data associated with the regional bus network, bus service operations, and major road network allowing developers to build applications enriched with TransLink data. 

To engage with the developer community, we actively monitor and contribute to a discussion group dedicated to the TransLink Open API service.

shortDescription: The Environmental Assessment Office (EAO) is an independent provincial agency responsible for conducting Environmental Assessments , and administering the B.C. Environmental Assessment Act.
contact:
Executive Director, Service Reform, Environmental Assessment Office


Dominique Bohn
Dominique.Bohn@gov.bc.ca
description:
Environmental Assessment Office

The Environmental Assessment Office (EAO) is an independent provincial agency responsible for conducting Environmental Assessments , and administering the B.C. Environmental Assessment Act. EAO leads major project reviews and prepares an assessment report detailing the findings of its review, which may also contain recommendations. The report, along with the project application, is referred to two government Ministers, who decide on project approval. Once approved, an EA certificate is issued.

The public can find information on projects under review on the EAO's website. Work is underway to improve web access to project information.  The computer code being developed for this is available under an open source license from the Government of B.C.

shortDescription: The Township of Langley is actively leveraging technology to reimagine service delivery to meet the changing needs and expectations of its many different stakeholders.
techContact:
Technical Contact


Shane Barnaby
Manager, Applications
sbarnaby@tol.ca
description:
Welcome to the Township of Langley

Known as the "Birthplace of BC," the Township of Langley is a place where the rich heritage of the past is combined with a vibrant vision for the future. Guided by its council-endorsed eGovernment Strategy, the Township is actively leveraging technology to reimagine service delivery to meet the changing needs and expectations of its many different stakeholders. 

The Township of Langley makes cemetery information available on its Open Data Portal, including a set of published API’s which the Township intends to self-consume, providing a lookup tool for the public to find individuals interred at one of its three municipal cemeteries. The Township hopes that by making this information and the corresponding API’s available, citizens and other organizations will be encouraged to create new services and tools that can be consumed by the public.

shortDescription: DataBC offers data connection services that allow users to view thousands of data layers from the BC Geographic Warehouse.
description:
DataBC offers data connection services that allow users to view thousands of data layers from the BC Geographic Warehouse (BCGW) in desktop geospatial software or custom via web-based map applications. These data connection services are provided to offer wide flexibility in map creation and data sharing. They are all available according to in the industry standard (OGC) Web Map Service (WMS) protocol, and some also available in Google Earth’s popular Keyhole Markup Language (KML) format, and in ArcGIS Server REST services format.

For more information, go here.
